Name: titanium tetrachloride production | titanium tetrachloride | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/24:Manufacture of basic metals/242:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals/2420:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals
Description: During the chlorination and refining process, titania slag is mixed with petroleum coke and placed in a chlorination furnace between 1073 and 1173 K, resulting in the production of crude titanium tetrachloride (TiCl4). The crude TiCl4 is refined further with reaction of the process being: 2TiO2 + 4Cl2 + 3C -> 2TiCl4 + 2CO + CO2. Titanium tetrachloride is used for the production of the pure titanium metal (titanium sponge). The data are assumed to be valid on average for 5 years after the publication of that article.
